channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Blue Origin pauses space tourism flights to focus on the moon
item.description: The company is trying to take advantage of President Donald Trump's desire to return astronauts to the lunar surface by the end of his term.

item.title: After Minneapolis, Tech CEOs Are Struggling to Stay Silent
item.description: Silicon Valley’s power brokers spent the past year currying favor with President Trump. Two deadly shootings in Minneapolis are now exposing the price...

item.title: 'Infinite Jest' Is Back. Maybe Litbros Should Be, Too
item.description: The notoriously challenging book is being re-released for its 30th anniversary. Its fandom is annoying, sure—but at least they read.

item.title: SpaceX’s IPO could open the floodgates — and secondaries are booming in the meantime
item.description: To unpack what SpaceX’s IPO chatter means, how private liquidity works before a debut, and what investors are looking for in today’s pre-IPO giants, w...

item.title: 6 Best Beard Trimmers (2026): Full Beards, Hair, Stubble
item.description: WIRED has been testing beard trimmers for six years. Our favorite is compact, reliable, ridiculously adjustable, and offers a five-year warranty.

item.title: Uber is literally in the driver’s seat when it comes to AV bets
item.description: Self-driving truck startup Waabi’s billion-dollar fundraise isn’t just about trucks. The deal, for $750 million up front plus another $250 million fro...

item.title: The Best Soundbars We’ve Tested: Sonos, Sony, Bose, and More
item.description: Every television deserves a row of speakers to call its own. These are our favorite soundbars from Samsung, Yamaha, Bose, and more.

item.title: Last 24 hours to grab your +1 pass at 50% off to TechCrunch Disrupt 2026
item.description: Today is the last day to lock in a +1 pass at 50% off to TechCrunch Disrupt 2026, happening on October 13-15 in San Francisco. Register here.

item.title: Instagram might soon let you remove yourself from someone’s Close Friends list
item.description: Since the feature's launch in 2018, users haven't been able to remove themselves from someone else's Close Friends list.

item.title: Anthropic brings agentic plug-ins to Cowork
item.description: The company says you can use plug-ins to "tell Claude how you like work done, which tools and data to pull from, how to handle critical workflows, and...
